主治﹕

For treatment of chronic diarrhea, chronic 
            dysentery, blood in 
stool, prolapse of retum, spermatorrhea, heavy 
            bleeding in the 
vagina not during menses, vagina discharge, 
            ulcer not healing, 
jaundice, scabies, nose bleeding, colitis with 
            blood.


            治久瀉，久痢，便血，脫肛，遺精，崩漏，帶下，潰瘍不斂，

黃疸，疥癬，衄 血，腸風下血。

            oxide
            

            manganese 4.85％、magnesium and 
            calcium 0.94%、water 14.75% 。

硅42.93%、 鋁

Internal use： in 
            decoction: 9 to 12 g, also can be put into pills or powder 
form. External use: apply to affected areas.

            內服：煎湯，9~12 克；或入丸、散。外用：研末撒

not compatible with

Preparation: Use fresh zi hua di ding to make juice and take internally. Combine with a small amount of xiong huang, smash and apply externally. For red eyes, combine with ju hua and chan tui to make a decoction and use as tea.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient).
Research: The extract of zi hua di ding can inhibit the growth of various bacteria and HIV at non-toxic concentrations.

Maladies Treated: boils in the mouth or tongue
inflammation of the roots of teeth
cough with heat in the lungs
Preparation: Grind ma chi xian and qing dai together. Apply externally.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of abnormal liver function. Indirubin can be toxic to the liver. Start from a small amount and monitor liver function regularly. Use care in cases without yinxu (yin deficient) condition with real heat. Most of the herb qing dai sold in the herb stores in Taiwan area are mainly pigments and do not contain any effective ingredient.
Research: Inhibits anthrax, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Shigella dysenteriae, Staphylococcus aureus, shows anti-inflammatory properties, improves symptoms of chronic myelogenous leukemia by lowering white cell count and improving bone marrow function.
Notes: Although the chemical formulae of indirubin and indigotin are the same, the structures are different; indigotin does not possess the anti-cancer characteristics, while the structure of indirubin deserves further study.

  color smoke. It does not contain water soluble pigment. During examination, 
  the water should not show dark blue color.

Preparation: Traditionally, seeds were used. Now leaves are also being used for making extracts. The main usage of the ginkgo leaf extract is in cardiovascular therapy. For oral consumption, boil root of ginkgo biloba and rock cane sugar with water, taken 4-5 doses a week.
Contraindications: Raw ginkgo nuts are toxic. Over consuming can cause vomiting, pain in the abdomen, diarrhea, muscle spasm, anxiety, and difficulty in breathing. The outer skin of the fruit contains ginkgo toxin.
Research: The average treatment time was 133 days for patients treated with ginkgo extracts for various conditions. Some classical medical literature reported fatalities linked to ginkgo nut consumption due to toxicity.
Notes: Ginkgo trees do not tolerate high heat or extreme cold. Despite being found in more than twenty provinces in China, many do not bear fruits. It grows well in regions like Guilin, Guangxi province.

In the subtropical zone, usually they are found in the higher altitude where the climate is cooler.全中國。亞熱帶到溫帶都有。北美有些地區。亞熱帶的較高地帶。Parts Being Used﹕應用部份: Traditionally, seeds were used. Now leaves are also being used for making extracts.傳統上是用種子。現代也用葉來提煉有效成份。Characteristics﹕性味:sweet, bitter, astringent, neutral, mildly toxic and very toxic for children.In the classical text of "Ben Cao Pin Hui Jing Yao" it states that the characteristics of the leaves of yin xing are bitter sweet, astringent, neutral. and belong to the lung meridian and can control the lungs and calm asthma, calm the mind and arrest pain, rid of water retention and stop diarrhea.甘﹐苦﹐澀 ﹐性平﹐對成人有小毒﹔但對小孩則很毒。《本草品匯精要》中記載銀杏葉�味甘苦、澀、性平,歸 肺經,能斂肺平喘、益心止痛、化濕止泄�。channel (meridian) relation﹕歸經:nuts: kidney, lungleaves: lung種子﹕腎﹐肺。葉﹕肺。Actions & Indications﹕主治:Uses of bai guo nuts:As a tonic. Lowers sludge level in blood. Expels phlegm and stops wheezing cough. Eliminates damp heat,  dampness and stops vaginal discharge in yeast infection. For incontinence, spermatorrhea (involuntary discharge of semen without orgasm), and frequent urination.果實用于﹕可作進補用﹐去淤血﹐補肺定喘﹐去痰 ﹐止百日咳﹐去濕熱﹐補 虛止白帶﹐治遺精﹐ 對年老力衰、小便清長、夜間尿多者， 有補腎縮尿的作用。Uses of extract of ginkgo leaves:cardiovascular diseases and diseases of the blood vessels of the brain: angina, arrhythmia, ischemia of the brain, edema of the brain, hardening of the brain arteries, brain infarction, high viscosity of blood, high blood lipids, high cholesterol,  claudication (間歇性跛行), arterial embolization, plebitis, vein dysfunction etc.neurological diseases: premature senility, vascular dementia,   memory impairment, aphasia, reading difficulty, Parkinson's disease, swallowing disorder after stroke, vestibular disorder (前庭障礙), para-sympathetic nervous system disorder, dizziness, vascular type of headache, anxiety, depression, stress ect.Meniere's disease, tinnitus,optical neuropathy, disease of the retina, macular degeneration  , diabetic retinopathy, retina arterial sclerosis.Diseases of the respiratory system: chronic bronchitis, TB, baby pneumonia, respiratory tract syncytial virus pneumonia (pneumoviridae), bronchopneumonia (capillary bronchitis), children chronic bronchitis, children asthmatic diseases.Diseases of the urinary tract:: urolithiasis (stone) incontinence, frequent urination.Other applications: protection in transplant rejection, pimples, anti fungus, scalding from hot liquid, allergies, chronic hepatitis B, acute pancreatitis, leukorrhea.The main usage of the ginkgo leave extract is in cardiovascular therapy (including dementia caused by circulation dysfunction.) Chemical ingredients:化學成份：From the seeds: 1. Flavin type of compounds (黄酮類化合物) (1) flavonol: kaempferol (山 奈黄素)[1], kaempferol-3-rhamnoglucoside[2]  hepatasacetyl kaempferol glucoside[3], kaempferol-3(6'-p-coumaroyl-glucosy1)-b-1,rh-amnoside] [4], quercetin (槲皮素), isorthamnetin (異鼠李黄素)[1], octaacetyl quercetin 3-glucoside [3], rutin [2].(2) flavin and its glucosides﹕heptaacetyl luteolin glucoside, octaaccetyldelphidenon glucoside[3].(3) dihydro-flavonol dihydro-catechin-pentaacetate, dihydro-epicatechin-pentaacetate, dihydro-gallocatechin-hexacetate, dihydro-epigallocatechin-hexacetate, are derivatives of catechin [3].(4) bi-flavonolbilobetin, ginkgetin, sciadopitysin, I-5'-methoxy-bilobetin, a-mentoflavone [5]2. Phenolsginkgolic acid, hydroginkgolic acid, ginkgolinic acid, ginkgol, bilobol [6], anacardic acid. 3. Organic acidsquinic acid, linoleic acid, shikimic acid, asorbic acid [3]. Skin contains formic acid, propionic acid, butyric acid, caprylic acid. 4. Alcohol groupsa-hexenol, sequoyitol, pinite, hexacosanol-1, octacosanol-1[3] , b-sitosterol , nonacosyl alcohol-10[10] ,ginnol [6].5. Trace minerals and othersginkgo-B (a saponin), d-sesamin [3]. Seed contains small amount of cyanophoric glucoside, gibberellin, cytokininlike substances. Toxicity Side EffectRaw ginkgo nuts are toxic. Over consuming can cause vomiting, pain in the abdomen, diarrhea, muscle spasm, anxiety and difficulty in breathy. [31] Some classical medical literature reported that over consuming had caused death in a group of refugees. The outer skin of the fruit contains ginkgo toxin. Ginkgo phenols and ginkgo toxin possess effect of hemolysis. Ginkgo toxin possesses  an anesthetic  effect on the central nervous system of frogs. A venous injection of 0.2g/kg on rabbits caused temporary raising of blood pressure then  with subsequent dropping of blood  pressure, breathing difficulty, panic and death.  Using the neutral portion of the gingko seed for skin injection of 6mg/kg has also caused death in mice.[3]  Using a large dosage of ginkgo leaf extract for venous injection continually for one week on dogs caused salivating, vomiting, diarrhea, and lack of appetite. In lab examination of tissues, it shows the increase of mucus secretion of the lower abdomen. Local injection causes local blood vessels to harden. It shows that in dogs and rabbits under anesthesia, the movement of intestines increases. A normal amount of flavonol does not affect the blood clotting time. A large dosage can interfere with the blood clotting time. Maladies Treated: Cold phlegm obstruction type of cough
Pain and fullness in rib cage
Asthmatic cough with abundance of phlegm
Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. External application: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and make paste. Apply to affect areas.

Botanical: Dipsacus asperoides, C. Y.Cheng et TM Ai

Maladies Treated: Chronic pain in loin and knees
Preparation: 10 to 20 g, Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
Geography: Middle and southern parts of China
Contraindications: Use the herb carefully in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with deficient Fire. There are reports mentioning that some patients had developed rash and itchiness.
Research: Inhibits and reverses osteoporosis, promotes healing of injured bones, alleviates the contraction of the uterus, thus calming the fetus, improves immune system, inhibits diplococcus pneumoniae, protects from lacking of vitamin E, kills Trichomoniasis, helps uterus to grow and develop.
Notes: For stabilizing pregnancy: gu shen an tai yin (防流產：固腎安胎飲).
Original Text:
xu duan, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

Last update: Sept 28, 2013; 10 P.m. 
LAH

Preparation: 10 grams to 30 grams per day, boiled with water. Raw sheng di huang juice can be used on open wounds.
Contraindications: Use caution when using large dosages. Large doses have shown to be toxic for the heart, especially in frogs. Sheng di huang should not be used in cases of pixu with dampness, or in cases of yangxu, and in pregnant women with blood deficiency of pixu or weixu. Shu di huang is less toxic, but side effects can include diarrhea, abdominal pain, dizziness, weakness, and palpitations.
Research: Treatment with hot water extracted Lycium barbarum and Rehmannia glutinosa protects against necrotic damage in rats with liver injury. Clinical reports indicate that di huang combined with gan cao promotes recovery of liver function.
Notes: Sheng di huang is prepared by drying, while shu di huang is prepared by steaming with other herbs.

Sheng di huang is cold and shu di huang is warm.甜﹐苦。生地 黃寒。熟地黃溫。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經： heart, kidney, and liver channels.入心﹐腎﹐肝 經。Actions & Indications:主治：It is being used as a blood tonic  usually for the weakness caused by tuberculosis, vomiting blood, nose bleeding,  coughing blood, bleeding in the uterus.一般作為補血藥。用於肺痨衰弱，吐血，鼻血， 咳血，子宫出血。Medical Function:药理： Medium dosages strengthen the function of the heart. Large doses are toxic for the heart. Increases blood pressure. Small doses constrict the blood vessels and large doses dilate the blood vessel. It possesses the characteristics of diuretics. It decreases the blood sugar and  inhibits carbohydrates being converted into blood sugar.treatment with hot water extracted Lycium barbarum and Rehmannia glutinosa (0.05% and 0.15% for each) for eight weeks protects against necrotic damage, indicated by decreases in plasma ALT and AST activities, and suppresses liver fibrosis by down-regulation of liver inflammation in rats with CCl(4)-induced liver injury.[1]Treatment of hepatitis: there are clinical reports that di huang and gan cao combined either in intramuscular or oral application,  have shown that it promotes  the recovery of liver function, especially the decrease of ALT were obvious and there were no local or systemic bad effect.Hot water-extracted crude gou qi zi (2-5 g/L) and di huang (5-10 g/L) inhibit proliferation and stimulate p53-mediated apoptosis in human hepatocellular carcinoma cells.[2] 中等剤量有强心作用。大剤量對心臟有毒。增加血壓。小剤量能收缩血管。大剤量能擴張血管。有利尿作用。降低血糖。能抑制碳水化合物變作血糖。以熱水水提取枸杞子，熟地黃0.05％和0.15％，餵給大鼠可防止四氯化碳導致 肝臟壞死，降低血漿中ALT和AST活動，並抑制肝纖維化[1]。治療肝炎：臨床報道地黃和甘草合用，無論是肌注或口服對傳染性肝炎都有一定作用， 促進肝功能恢復，尤以ALT下降顯著且無局部及全身不良反應。苟杞子（2-5克/升）和地黃（5-10克/升）熱水提取物，能抑制人類肝癌細胞 增殖和促進p53介導的細胞凋亡。[2]Chemical ingredients:化學成份：See chemical ingredients:按此看化 學成份：Dosage:用 量：10 grams to 30 grams per day, boiled with water. Raw sheng di huang juice can be used on open wounds.每日量：10~30克，水煎服。生地黃汁可用 於傷口。Samples of formulae:處方舉例：shi quan da bu tang, 十全 大補湯，liu wei di huang wan 六味地黄丸,  zhi bai di huang wan知柏地黄丸,Modern Research:现代研究：To be loadedCautions:注意：Use caution when using large dosages. Large doses has shown to be toxic for the heart of frogs.Sheng di huang should not be used in cases of pixu with dampness, or in cases of yangxu, and in pregnant women with blood deficiency of pixu or weixu (stomach deficiency). Shu di huang is less toxic and the side effects are mild.The side effects can include diarrhea, abdominal pain, dizziness, weakness, and palpitations.大劑量可能對心臟有毒。生地黃﹕脾 虛濕重，陽 虛，大便溏瀉者不宜用；中焦濕勝者要慎用為宜。懷孕期間有血 虛，脾 胃虛弱不宜用。熟地黃﹕熟地毒素較弱，但脾 胃虛弱，痰多﹐中焦濕蘊，一般忌用熟地。副作用包括腹痛，眩暈，無 力，心律不整。 [1]Am J Chin Med. 2011;39(6):1173-91. [2] World Journal of Gastroenterology (Impact Factor: 2.55). 07/2006; 12(28):4478-84. When di huang has been just prepared by drying, it is called sheng di huang. Sheng means raw.When di huang has been prepared by steaming together with other herbs, it is called shu di huang. Shu means cooked. P53 is a protein that is the product of a tumor suppressor gene, regulates cell growth and proliferation, and prevents unrestrained cell division after chromosomal damage, as from ultraviolet or ionizing radiation. Preparation: To take orally: in powder form, 0.7 to 2 g.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of cold stomach or in damp phlegm. Warning: there are fake ma bao in the market.
Research: Components of the genuine calculus Equi and false ma bao were analyzed. The main components of the genuine ma bao are NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O, whereas the main components of the false ma bao are CaCO3.
Notes: Ma bao is a valuable Chinese medicinal material, with sedative, phlegm-transforming, and detoxifying effects.

Distribution:

            herb is mainly produced in Hebei, Inner Mongolia, Liaoning, Jilin, Heilongjiang,

藥材主產河北，內蒙古，遼寧，吉林，黑龍江，新疆，甘肅，雲南，貴州，西藏等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

cold, 
            salty, slightly bitter and slightly toxic.
性涼，味咸微苦，有小毒。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕

heart, liver.
入心，肝二經。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 

 



Actions & 
            Indications:
主治﹕

For 
            treatment of epilepsy, 

yinxu (yin deficient), hot phlegm, 
            mania, delusion and losing consciousness, nose bleeding, vomiting blood, 
            or boils.治驚癇癲狂，陰
            虚痰熱， 神志昏迷，吐血衄血，惡瘡腫毒。




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕

contains
            struvite (ammonium magnesium phosphate, 
            NH4MgPO4.6H2O), 
            dittmarite (NH4MgPO4. H2O),magnesium carbonate, and 
            calcium carbonate.含鳥 
            糞石，磷酸鎂銨，碳酸鎂，碳酸鈣等。




Dosage:
用量﹕

to 
            take orally: in powder form, 0.7 to 2 g.
內服：研末，2～5分。




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕



Name of formula: diang kuang ma 
            bao san 
Application: 
            for treatment of madness, manic anxiety, delirium, mania caused by hot 
            phlegm (symptoms include high fever, delirium, even epilepsy and resulting 
            in mania), spitting saliva, talking without making sense, fright and 
            insomnia, crying and laughing, and schizophrenia. 
Composition: 
            ma bao 30 g, hu po 
            3 g, long xian 
            xiang 1g,
            zhen zhu（bake 
            with tofu）0.3 g,
            niu huang
            
           1.5 g
Grind 
            all herb into fine powder. Bottle 1 g each.
Dosage: 
            take half bottle each time (0.5 g). If ilness is serious, take 1 bottle 
            (1 g)

藥方名：癲狂馬寶散

功能主冶：鎮靜，豁痰，安神，定志。主神經錯亂， 
            狂躁不安。痰熱蒙蔽心竅，症見高熱、神昏、譫語，甚或痙厥等引起的癲狂，口吐涎沫，神識不清，語言譫妄，瘋狂打鬧，煩躁不安，驚惕失眠，哭笑無常
            ，及精神分裂症等。

組成：馬寶 2兩，琥
            珀 1錢，龍
            涎香 1錢，珍
            珠（豆腐炙）1分，牛黃
5分。
製法：上 
            研細末，裝瓶重3分。
            用法用量：每次病輕者服半瓶 (一分半）， 
            病重者服1瓶 (3分)。
 




Modern Research:
現代研究﹕

 



Warning, oxicity 
            & Cautions:
注意，毒素與禁忌﹕

Not 
            to use in cases of
            cold stomach 
            or in damp phlegm.
Warning: there are fake ma bao 
            in the market. See

胃寒 
痰濕者忌用。
注意：市場上有偽馬 
            寶。有些是水泥做成的。有些是用其他獸類的胃結石代替的。 真馬寶的主要成份是含磷酸鎂銨而假馬寶主要成份是碳酸鈣。



　[1] 
        癲狂馬寶散(衛生部藥品標准中藥成方制劑第三冊(WS3-B-0669-91))
Note:

Yinxu with hot phlegm syndrome: cough 
        with sticky white or yellow phlegm, may even with blood in phlegm, achy 
        and tight sensation in chest area, sometimes with low grade fever, listless 
        sleep, red tongue with thin yellow fur, slippery and thin pulse.
 
陰虚痰 熱主 
        要症候：咳 嗽，咯吐白黏痰或黃稠痰，甚或痰中帶血，胸脅悶痛 ，時有低熱，夜眠不安，舌紅，苔薄黃，脈細滑數。
 
Damp phlegm 
        syndrome: cough with abundance of phlegm, fullness in chest are, nausea, 
        vomiting, dizziness, palpitation.
 
濕痰主 要症
        候：咳 嗽痰多，胸膈脹滿，嘔吐惡心，或暈眩心悸。
 
Cold 
        stomach syndrome: stomach ache due to weather becoming cold, or the 
        body getting chill, or eating cold food, feeling cold in stomach while having 
        pain, pain become less if getting warmth.
 
胃寒
[Analysis 
        and identification of calculus equi components]
[Article in Chinese]

 Zhu 
        Y,
        
        Chen Y,
        
        Dai L,
        
        Liu W.
Center of Material Analysis, Nanjing University.
Components of the genuine calculus Equi and false ma 
        bao were analyzed by X-ray diffraction. The results indicate that the main 
        components of the genuine ma bao are NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O and MgHPO4.3H2O, 
        whereas the main components of the false Mabao is CaCO3.
PMID: 9642387 [PubMed - indexed for MEDLINE]
馬寶成分的分析與鑒別朱育平， 
        陳逸　，戴樂美（南 京大學現代分析中心２１００９３）劉午霞 （江 蘇省藥品檢驗所南京２１０００８）摘要用ｘ射線衍肘（ＷＡＸＤ）方法分析了８種馬寶 
        和１種偽馬寶的成分。結 果表明：馬寶的主要成分是 ＮＨ４Ｍｇ ＰＯ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ、ＮＨ４．ＭｇＯ４和ＭｇＨＯ４�３Ｈ２Ｏ。而假馬寶的主要成分是Ｃａ 
        ＣＯ３。
 

馬寶是一種貴重中藥材，具有鎮驚化痰，清熱解毒之 
        功效。因其是馬的胃腸道中的結石，故主要 成分為無機鹽。傳統鑒別方法是取少量粉末，洒於錫紙上，下面用火烘烤。如粉末很快聚於一處，並發出馬尿氣味，即 
        是 真馬寶。如無此現象即是 偽馬寶。為了確定真偽馬寶的無機鹽成分，本文用ＷＡＸＤ對此進行了分析與鑒別。１實驗部分１．１樣品來源８種來源不同的馬寶 
        和１種 偽馬寶粉末，均由江蘇 省藥品檢驗所提供。１．２儀器日本理學Ｄ／ＭＡＸ－ＲＡ型Ｘ射線衍射儀，Ｃｕ靶（波長λ＝０．１５４１ｎｍ）。２結果和討 
        論真、偽馬 寶的ｘ射線衍射圖分 別如圖１和圖２所示。根據Ｂｒａｇｇ公式（２ｄｓｉｎθ＝λ），由峰位２θ計算出晶面間距ｄ值。將實測ｄ值與ＪＣＰＤＳ 
        （粉末衍射標准 聯合會）卡片對照 來確定樣品中含有的各種成分。因本系列的樣品中含有不止一種成分或物相，故有個別譜線重疊。在此僅以油馬寶為例，將其 
        和偽馬寶的數據分別 列於表１和表２ 內。為了簡便起見，表中僅列出８個譜線值。由譜圖和表內的數據表明：真馬寶和偽馬寶的成分是截然不同的。油馬寶和棕 
        球馬寶是由NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O 和 MgHPO4.3H2O,
        所組成。草紋馬寶 中主要成分是ＭｇＨＰＯ４�３

        的譜圖與卵 圓和淺黃馬寶相比，峰都比較低。這表明：在棕圓和紅片馬寶中ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ和ＭｇＨＰＯ�３Ｈ２Ｏ的含量 相對較少。偽馬寶的主
        要成分是兩種不 同物相的ＣａＣＯ３，即方解石（六角晶系）和文石（正交晶系）。曾有文獻記載：�馬寶主要成分是磷酸鎂、碳酸鈣、碳 酸鎂等無機鹽。�根

Preparation: Take orally; in decoction 3-9 g, or make into powder or juice. External application: appropriate amount, smash and apply.
Contraindications: We have not found any information yet.
Research: Invitro of 62.5mg per ml of bian dou huo decoction can inhibit the growth of Shigella sonnei and Flexner's bacillus.
Notes: Bai beng: is a traditional Chinese medical term describing frequent large amounts of vaginal white color discharge. Fire rendered salt refers to salt produced by using fire.

bian dou hua 扁 
    豆花  (in English and Chinese 中英文)

Translated 
    by: Joe Hing kwok Chu
 



Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕


Flos Dolichos lablab




Botanical name:
拉丁生物學名﹕


Dolichos lablab L.




Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕


henzuka




Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕


p'yontuhwa






        Pron. in Cantonese::
粵音﹕


  bin2 
        dau6 faa1




Other Names:
別名﹕


nan dou hua 南豆花




Common Name:
英文名﹕


Flower of Hyacinth Dolichos




Distribution:
產地﹕


Mainly distributed in Liaoning, 
        Hebei, Shanxi, Shaanxi, Shandong, Jiangsu, Anhui, Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Fujian, 
        Taiwan, Henan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangdong, Hainan, Guangxi, Sichuan, Guizhou, 
        Yunnan provinces of China and other places.
主要分佈於遼寧、河北、山西、陝西、山東、江蘇、安徽、浙江、
        江西、福建、台灣、河南、湖北 、湖南、廣東、海南、廣西、四川、貴州、雲南等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕


平，甘，淡，無毒。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕


spleen, stomach, large intestine.
脾，胃，大腸。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 



Invitro of 62.5mg per 
        ml of bian dou huo  decoction can inhibit the growth of
        Shigella sonnei,
        
Flexner's bacillus.

每毫升含生藥62.5mg的扁豆花煎液在試管內可抑制宋內氏型、弗氏型痢疾杆菌生 
        長。




Actions & Indications:
主治﹕


To relieve summer heat rid of
        
dampness; to improve digestion and correct 
        pixu condition. For treatment of summer heat injury, dampness, fever, diarrhea, 
        dysentery, vaginal discharge, swelling form impact injuries.
解暑化濕，和中健脾 。主夏傷暑濕，發熱，泄瀉，痢疾，赤白帶
        下，跌打傷腫。




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕





The flower contains:



花含:





proanthocyanidins



原花青甙





flavonoids



黃酮類





anthocyanidins



花青素





conmarins



香豆精







Daly Dosage:
每日用量﹕



Take orally; in decoction 3-9 g, or make 
        into powder or make into juice.
External application: appropriate 
        amount, smash and apply.

Note:
 
Bai beng: is a traditional Chinese 
    medical term describing frequent large amount of vaginal white color discharge 
    like cooked rice liquid or like transparent sticky liquid. This is more common 
    among weak elderly or middle-aged women. It can happen in vaginitis or fallopian 
    tube cancer, endometrial cancer and other diseases.
 
Fire rendered salt: 
    this refers to salt produced by using fire verses those produced by sunlight. 
    In areas where sunlight is abundance, salt are produced by drying sea water 
    or salt lake water. In areas where sunlight is scanty, salt is produced by boiling 
    using fire to evaporate the water.
 
註：
 
白崩：婦女陰道內不時有白色如米泔樣或 
    透明樣黏液流出，量多如崩狀不止者稱白崩。以老年或中年體弱的婦女多見。陰道炎或輸卵管癌症、子宮內膜腺癌等病也會有白崩。
 

燒鹽: 是指用火提煉的鹽。在陽光多的地區一般用陽光曬鹽。在陽光少的地區常用火提煉的。 
    那就是曬鹽。

Preparation: The tips of sugar cane should be stored in winter while still green to preserve their nutrients. They can be taken directly or used in feed for animals.
Contraindications: Avoid use if the tips are wilted, as nutrients may be destroyed.
Research: Studies show that gan zhe shao has properties that help relieve heat, moisten dryness, stop cough, and clear phlegm.
Notes: A good practice for storage is to ensure anaerobic conditions to maintain freshness and nutrients.
Original Text:
gan zhe shao, tip of sugar cane, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University  Home  現 代中藥辭典Search this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　　                                                        gan zhe shao (tip of sugar cane)  甘蔗梢   Compiled and translated by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu    按此看中文 Gan zhe shao (tip of sugar cane) contains 12 to 13% of crude protein, 16 kinds of amino acid and many types of sugar. Under storage condition in winter temperature, due to anaerobic fermentation of lactic acid bacteria, the sugar content gradually turns into lactic acid. When the lactic acid arrives at a certain level, it will inhibit the destruction of the nutrients by other micro organism. Thus the tips of the sugar canes can preserve the green color, the juice and the nutrition value. So, winter storage of the tips of sugar cane is a good method to solve the feed of farm animals for winter and early spring when the feeds are scarce. The fresh tips of sugar cane contain rich nutrition, large amount of chlorophyll, amino acid, crude protein and sugar. When they are wilted, the nutrients can be destroyed. So, it is a good practice to store them for winter when they are still green. Medical Application: for treating irritability, thirst, nausea, vomiting, dry cough, hard stool, hangover from drinking alcohol. Property: cool, sweet. Chemical ingredients of the  juice of the tips of sugar cane:aspartic acid：37mg/100mlglutamic acid： 10mg/100mlserine： 12mg/100mlglycine： 5mg/100mlhistidine：22.6mg/100mlarginineprolinevalinemethionine.  Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 甘蔗梢是寶，冬貯養畜好 發布時間：2006-2-14 來源：中國農民網 　甘蔗梢粗蛋白質含量高達12%～13%，含有16種氨基酸和多種糖。在冬貯狀態下，通過乳菌等厭氧發酵，甘蔗梢中的糖分會逐步轉化為乳酸，當乳酸達到一 定濃度時，就會抑制甘蔗梢中的營養成分被其他微生物破壞，從而使甘蔗梢長期保持青綠、多汁，營養價值不會發生太大的變化。因此，冬貯甘蔗梢是解決冬季和初 春家畜缺乏青飼料的好辦法。鮮嫩的甘蔗梢營養豐富，含大量葉綠素、氨基酸、粗蛋白質和糖分。甘蔗梢干枯後，這些營養成分都會遭到破壞，甚至轉化為有毒物質 ，產生大量有害細菌、病毒和寄生虫。因此，應在冰凍前、甘蔗梢尚為青綠色時冬貯。  　　冬貯通常採用三種方法：  　　一是挖窖。要選擇地勢高、地下水位低、向陽的地方挖窖。要挖成長方形，深100～150厘米、寬60～80厘米，長度不限。  　　二是用混凝土和紅磚建池。  　　三是將廢棄的房屋、地面和牆壁用薄膜覆蓋起來進行冬貯。把甘蔗梢切碎後放入貯藏池，千方百計壓緊，越緊越好。最後用農膜覆蓋，用河沙或泥土密封。在取 用前切忌開封，以免破壞厭氧環境。冬貯50～60天後便可開封取用。取用時，隻能打開一處，分段分層取用。啟封後，如發現霉變，則應把霉變部分除去；如果 發現甘蔗梢顏色黃綠、柔軟多汁、有酒香味，則為上等品，可直接飼喂牛、羊、兔、鵝等草食畜禽，也可以添加一些精飼料混合飼喂。 性味：甘甜， 寒。 天然甘蔗梢汁中含有：天門冬氨酸：37mg/100ml ，穀 氨酸： 10mg/100ml，絲氨酸： 12mg/100ml ，甘氨酸： 5mg/100ml，組按酸： 22.6mg/100ml，精氨酸，脯氨酸 ，纈氨酸，蛋氨酸。  經藥理研究，甘蔗具有清熱潤燥、止咳、清 痰、下氣等功用，可用於熱病傷津、心煩口渴、反胃嘔吐，肺燥咳嗽、大便燥結等症，還可解酒毒。 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressClick here for inquiry Copyright Notice 按此看關於版權問題List of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryToxicity of Some Herbs Side Effect of Some Herbs Herbs that can be toxic to kidneysTraditional Chinese MedicineTCM DiagnosisSamples of FormulaeAcupuncturecopy right 版權所有Qigong (chi kung)Prescribed Drug DictionaryEmail our web master for  your suggestion (not for inquiry)Biochemistry DictionaryGeneral Online LibraryQigong classesFake Email WarningResearch LibrarianSearchQigong classesHomeWeather ReportDisclaimerSearch this site

Preparation: Dosage: 10 to 20 g. Concentrate extract 0.5 ~ 2 g.
Contraindications: Use with care for those with yinxu with fire syndrome.
Research: Decoction of Millettia Dielsiana has shown to improve anemia and possesses anti-inflammatory effects; enhances macrophage function and inhibits platelet coagulation.
Notes: Administrative use for various blood-related conditions; combines with herbs that have blood and qi tonic properties.

Preparation: 3 to 12 grams; can be taken as a decoction or applied externally.
Contraindications: Use with care if the patient is weak.
Research: Ethanol extract of xu chang qing has shown preventative effects on apoptosis in neuron cells post herpes simplex virus encephalitis in lab mice.
Notes: Commonly used for arresting pain, stopping itching, reducing swelling, and detoxification. Can also be used in for treatments related to snake bites.

Preparation: Dosage: 15 to 30 g daily for internal use. For external use, use an appropriate amount, smash fresh herb, and apply to the affected area. Example preparation for decoction includes using dried tie xian cai 30 to 60 g.
Contraindications: Do not use during pregnancy. Use with caution in those who are old or weak with Qi deficiency.
Research: In vitro, tie xian cai decoction exhibits antibiotic effects against several common Shigella bacteria, especially Shigella dysenteriae, with noted activity against Staphylococcus aureus and Vibrio cholerae as well.
Notes: Differential antibacterial effects are observed based on different plant parts and the type of bacteria.

Asian copperleaf [1]Distribution:產地﹕Distributed in the south of the Yangtze River, middle and lower end of Yellow River, coastal and southwest and south China provinces other regions in China; additionally, in North Korea, Vietnam, Japan, the Philippines, New York state of the United States, .在中國分佈於長江以南，黃河中下游，沿海及西南、華南各省區；此外，朝鮮、越南、日本、菲律賓, 美國的紐約州也有。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, tart, cool.苦、澀，涼。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕heart, lung, large intestine, small intestine.心，肺，大腸，小腸。Medical functions:藥理﹕ Medical function: In vitro tie xian cai decoction possesses antibiotic effect on several common Shigella antibacterial, especially on Shigella dysentery bacillus (2-fold dilution method in vitro). The dilution of 1:256, not only possesses bacteria inhibition effect also possesses bactericidal effect. Antibiotic effect on Shushi and Freund Shigella is less, and the antibiotic effect of Shigella sonnei bacilli is least. In vitro the tablets made ​​of tie xian cai also possesses anti Shigella effect.  In vitro, 50% tie xian cai decoction possesses various degrees of inhibitory effect on Staphylococcus aureus, Vibrio cholerae, Bacillus anthracis, Shushi Shigella (using agar plate method). The antibacterial effect seems to be different on different parts of the roots, stems, and leaves, and on  different bacteria. Tie xian cai alcohol extract also possesses  antibacterial effect. 藥理﹕鐵莧水煎液在體外對幾種常見的痢疾杆菌都有抗菌作用，尤其對志賀氏痢疾杆菌效果好（試管內2倍稀釋法），在稀釋度為1:256時，不但有抑菌效力，且有殺菌作用。對舒氏和弗氏痢疾杆菌作用次之，對宋內氏痢疾杆菌效果最差。以鐵莧制成的片劑，在體外亦有同樣抗痢疾杆菌之效。50％鐵莧煎劑在體外對金黃色葡萄球菌、霍亂弧菌、炭疽杆菌、舒氏痢疾杆菌有不同程度抑菌作用（瓊脂平板法）；其根，莖、葉中皆含抗菌成分，但對不同細菌，用植物的不同部分其抗菌效力似有差異；鐵莧醇提物亦有同樣抗菌作用。Actions & Indications:主治﹕Detoxifies, improves nutrition, stops dysentery, arrests bleeding. For treatment of enteritis, dysentery, amoebic dysentery, malnutrition in children, hepatitis, malaria, vomiting blood, epistaxis, hematuria, blood in the stool, uterine bleeding; topical treatment of carbuncle sores, traumatic bleeding, eczema, dermatitis, snake bites.清熱解毒，消積，止痢，止血。用於腸炎，細菌性痢疾，阿米巴痢疾，小兒疳積，肝炎，瘧疾，吐血，衄血，尿血，便血，子宮出血；外用治癰癤瘡瘍，外傷出血，濕疹，皮炎，毒蛇咬傷。  Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕ Daly Dosage:每日用量﹕15 to 30 g.External use: appropriate amount. Preparation: For oral consumption: decoction, 15 ~ 30g, Fresh herb 60 ~ 120g; or squeeze for juice and mix with honey and take orally or make into juice and gargle. External use: appropriate amount, wash, smash and apply topically or washed affected areas or sun dried and make into powder and make into dressing or topical ointment or cream for applying to affected areas.
Contraindications: The leaves of some Pandanus species are known to contain calcium oxalate crystals. It may be harmful to those with decreased kidney function.
Research: P. amaryllifolius contains lectin with anti-human viruses like: herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1), influenza virus (H1N1). P. amaryllifolius ethanol extract in vitro induced apoptosis on hormone independent breast cancer cell line MDA-MB-231. The leaf extract can significantly retarded oil oxidation and deterioration.
Notes: Modern research suggests possible liver toxicity from noni fruit, with some individuals having sensitivity to hepatotoxic effects.

It may be harmful to those with decreased kidney function.有些香林投種類的葉子含草酸鈣晶體，對腎臟功能不佳者可能不利。Possible liver toxicity of noni fruit:The Panel on Dietetic Products, Nutrition and Allergies of European Food Safety Authority concludes that �Morinda citrifolia (Noni) fruit puree and concentrate as novel food 
ingredients� under the specified conditions are considered safe for the general population. 
However the Panel considers that the increasing number of case reports might indicate that some individuals have a particular sensitivity for hepatotoxic effects to noni fruit products.  Noni fruit (and its products) are listed by the U.S. State Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as toxic items.
There are reports that:
(1) those with renal dysfunction had higher chance for renal damage.
(2) more cases of acute hepatitis have been reported after consumption of noni products. 諾利果可能對肝臟有毒：歐洲食品安全局的飲食產品，營養和過敏專家小組得出結論認為諾麗諾麗果漿和濃縮新型食品
對於一般人群，在特定條件下被認為是安全的。
然而，小組認為，越來越多的病例報告可能表明，一些人對諾麗果產品的肝毒性作用特別敏感。 諾利果(及其產品)被美國國家藥物食品管理局(FDA)列為有毒植物。有報告指出：(1)腎功能低下的人，更會造成腎功能的傷害。(2)多例在食用諾麗產品後，造成急性肝炎。 Reference material : Annals of Vegetation of China  參考資料]《中國植物誌》[1] BMC Complement Altern Med. 2012 Aug 22;12:134. doi: 10.1186/1472-6882-12-134.[2] Int J Biochem Cell Biol. 2004 Aug;36(8):1440-6.[3] http://gernot-katzers-spice-pages.com/[4] http://agricenter.jogjaprov.go.id/index.php?action=generic_content.main&id_gc=256[5][6] 参考文献　〔有用事典〕　７７1　〔花木〕　１９２(日文) (in Japanese)Problems with website? Preparation: Dosage is typically 6 to 15 grams. Can be used raw, stir-fried, wine-treated, or vinegar-treated depending on the condition.
Contraindications: Do not use chi shao after giving birth. Raw bai shao should not be used in case of abdominal pain or diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Use chao bai shao instead.
Research: The acute oral toxicity of aconitine in rats was significantly reduced by paeoniflorin. Various studies suggest that paeoniflorin can alleviate behavioral and cognitive impairments and may have antidepressant effects.
Notes: Bai shao is commonly used for addressing blood stasis and has mild analgesic properties. Chi shao yao has stronger effects on removing blood stasis and is used in injuries and blood clots.

The action of Paeonia lactiflora may be mediated via the central monoaminergic neurotransmitter system. [5] 解痙降血壓，能擴張外周血管 ，降低外周阻力擴張冠狀動脈鎮靜、鎮痛及抗驚厥解熱、抗炎及抗菌對致癌物質黃霉素有解毒 作用芍藥與黃芪提取物，抗卡介苗和脂多醣引起的小鼠肝損傷有保護作。在體外實驗，發現有抑制乙型肝炎病毒作用[3]有報導說其中的活性成份，芍藥苷， 能夠逆轉或減輕損傷和認知損傷[4]在動物試驗中, 本品顯示有抗抑鬱作用。芍藥的作用可能通過中樞的單胺神經遞質系統介導的。 [5]Actions & Indications:主治 ﹕Bai shao is being used for removing blood stasis and as a mild analgesic by addressing blood stasis . For menstrual dysfunction, vagina yeast infection, uterine bleeding. Lessens liver yang ascending , alleviates abdominal pain. For headache and dizziness due to  liver yang ascending. For spermatorrhea. For pain in abdomen and diarrhea. For common cold and flu. (as in gui zhi tang, ma huang tang)Chi shao yao has a much stronger effect in removing blood stasis . It is being used more often than bai shao in injuries like broken bones, dislocated joints, sprains and injuries from impacts also in blood clots. It is use as a tonic, pain killer, diuretic and for ridding of gas from stomach and intestine and for child birth difficulty. Do not use chi shao after giving birth.白芍常用于驅淤血并略 有止痛作用。用于月经不調，带下，子宫出血，遗精，肝 陽上亢所致的頭痛，晕眩。。 改善肝 陽上亢症狀，减輕腹痛.。用于傷 風感冒 如 桂枝湯，, 麻黄湯。赤芍對驅 淤血功效較白芍强。常用於跌打損傷， 折骨，脱胶，扭傷。可作補藥，止痛 (因驅 淤血作用)，利尿，驅腸胃氣，難産。産後忌用赤芍。Dosage:用量 ﹕6 ~ 15 grams6~15 克。Chemical ingredients: paeonol, paeonin,  triterpenoids, sistosterol,  , benzoic acid, β sitosterol, gallotannin, pedunculagin, 1-O-Galloylpedunculagin , eugeniin,  tannin acid, fat, essential oil, resin, sugar, starch, and protein.Roots contain:根含:paeoniflorin芍藥甙oxypaeoniflorin氧化芍藥甙benzoylpaeoniflorin,苯甲酰芍藥甙albiflorin白芍甙paeoniflorigenone芍藥甙無酮galloylpaeoniflorin沒食子酰芍藥甙z－1s，5R-β-pinen-10-yl-β-vicianosideβ-蒎-10-烯基-β-巢菜甙lacioflorin芍藥新甙paeoni-lactone)A、B、C芍藥內酯β-siiosierolβ-谷甾醇daucosterol胡蘿蔔甙Also isolated from the tannin of the roots:還從根的鞣質中分得:1，2，3，6-tetra-O-galloyl-β-D-glucose1，2，3，6-四沒食子酰基葡萄糖1,2,3,4，6-penta-O-galloyl-β-D-glucose,2,3,4,6-五沒食子酰基葡萄糖六沒食子酰基葡萄糖七沒食子酰基葡萄糖Also  contain:l又含:catechin右旋兒茶精evaporating oi:揮發油:benzoic acid苯甲酸,paeonol牡丹酚and 33 kinds of other alcohol and phenol compounds及其他33 種醇類和酚類成份Modern use:現代 應 用﹕Being used in:muscle spasm of limbs, back and neck, face. Maladies Treated: Yin deficient with afternoon fever and night sweating
Toothache due to heat in stomach
Cough due to heat in the lung
Preparation: Daily dosage is 10 to 20 g; concentrated extract is 0.5 to 2 g.
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Use with care for those who are prone to bleeding.
Research: Modern research findings mentioned in Military Medical Journal, 2006, issue 4.

Maladies Treated: Pain in lower back and knees
Preparation: Dosage: 12 g ~ 18 g. Do not boil for a long period because it contains essential oil which is an active ingredient.
Contraindications: Do not use in case of pixu (spleen deficient)/weak digestion with loose stool.
Research: High ratio of Zn/Cu is prone to coronary heart diseases. The Huai ju hua of Henan has a lower Zn/Cu ratio which may be beneficial in preventing coronary heart diseases.
Notes: Wild ju hua is reported to be better than julua in lowering cholesterol, lowering blood pressure, and inhibiting infection.

sight.治肝腎不足，虛火上炎所致的目眩頭暈，視物不清，眼睛澀 痛，腰膝酸軟，迎風流淚等證。目赤腫痛、久視昏暗、迎風流淚、怕日羞明、中心性視神經炎、慢性青光眼、神經衰弱、球後視神經炎、耳鳴耳聾、 視力障礙等。 Medical function:藥理作用﹕Effect on cardio-vascular system: it has obvious effect on dilating the The result can be the inhibiting effect on the CNS.Ye ju hua (wild ju hua) is better than ju hua in lowering cholesterol, lowering blood pressure and inhibit infection. 對心血管系統的影響: 有明顯的擴張冠狀動脈的作用，是直接鬆弛冠狀動脈的平滑肌所致。抗 炎。抗病原微生 物的作用: 體外試驗，對金黃色葡萄球菌、乙型溶血性鏈球菌、大腸桿菌、痢疾桿菌有 療效。抑菌作用現有研究認為［1］ 揮發油是菊花抗菌作用的物質基礎，其中的樟腦、龍腦則是其發揮抗菌作用的主要成分。解熱作用: 菊花浸膏灌胃，對人工發熱的家兔有解熱的作用，其作用是對中樞神經系統 的抑制有關。野菊花對於降低膽固醇、降血壓、抑制感染三方面療效優於菊花。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕Name of formula: qi ju di huang wanApplication: swollen red eyes, sensitive to blowing of wind and light.Composition: shu di huang, shan zhu yu, huai shan yao, fu ling  , mu dan pi, ze xie  , gou qi z, ju hua.Boil all herb with water except ju hua which is to be added to the hot liquid when ready. It can also made into pill form. 藥方名：杞菊地黃丸  《小兒藥證直訣》【主治】    主治：目赤腫痛，迎風流淚，羞明症。【組成】    組成：熟 地 黃 、山 茱 萸、 淮 山 、茯 苓、 牡 丹皮 、澤 瀉、枸 杞 子、 甘菊花 。 modern research:現代研究：High ration of Zn/Cu is prone to coronary heart diseases. The Huai ju hua of Henan has a lower Zn/Cu ratio which may be beneficial in preventing coronary heart diseases.河南懷菊花中Zn/Cu比值较低，可能對防止冠心病有利。高比值較易患冠心病。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕化學成份﹕Chemical ingredients:腺嘌呤 (adenine)膽鹼  (choline)水蘇鹼  (stachydrine)菊红甙  (chrysanthemin,維 生素  (B1 vitamin B1)芹菜素  (apigenin)  刺槐素  (acacetin)黃連甙 I  (coptiside I)菊花萜二醇  (chrysandiol)(chrysantemin A and B)氯菊素  (chlorochrymorin)龍腦, (camphor)樟腦 (borneol)The following is from:Study and report of: ZHANG Jian,  QIAN Da-wei, LI You-bin, YIN Zhi-qi　  基金項目：江蘇省自然科學基金項目(BK2001219);江蘇省公益項目(BM2004525) 作者簡介：張健,通訊作者86-25-85639644;E-mail:zjwonderful@hotmail.com 作者單位：張健（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　錢大瑋（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　李友賓（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　殷志琦（中國藥科大學天然藥物化學教研室,南京,210009）　1. 香葉 木素(chrysoeriol),2. 木犀 草素(luteolin),3. 芹菜 素 (apigenin),4. 香葉 木素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(chrysoeriol 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,4),5. 木犀 草素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(luteolin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,5),6. 金合 歡素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,6),7. 刺槐 苷(acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranosyl(6→1)-α-L-rhamnopy-ranoside,7),8. 金合 歡素7-O-(6\"-O-乙酰)-β -D-葡萄糖苷(acacetin 7-O-(6\"-O-acetyl)-β-D-glucopyranoside,8),9. .金 合歡素(acacetin,9),10. 山 奈(kaempferol, 10),11. 異 澤蘭黃素(eupatilin,11),12. 大 黃素(emodin,12),13. 大 黃(chrysophanol,13)14. 大 黃素甲醚 (physcion,14).其中化合物8～14均 為首次從菊花中分離得到.看 http://www.zhiti.cn/html/2008-12/242.htmDosage:用量:12 g ~ 18 g . Maladies Treated: Cough due to coldness in lungs
Cough due to heat in lungs
Preparation: Taking orally, in decoction: 2 to 10 g; or in powder or pill form. External application: use appropriate amount, smash and apply.
Contraindications: Use extreme care in cases of coughing out blood or pus. Not to use in cases of chronic coughing with yinxu (yin deficient) condition.
Research: Toxicity and cautions noted include care in specific conditions. It is beneficial to use with zi wan and incompatible with several other herbs.
Notes: It is known for various formulations and includes toxic components that require caution in certain conditions.

Preparation: Dosage is 10 to 20 g. Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
Contraindications: Do not use when there is no symptoms of damp-heat.
Research: Content of ergone in P. umbellatus varied significantly from habitat to habitat with contents ranging from 2.13 to 59.17 g.
Original Text:
zhu ling, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

zhu 
    ling 豬苓    (in English and Chinese 
    中英文)
 by: 
    Joe Hing kwok Chu  




Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕


Sclerotium 
        polypori Umbrellati




Biological name:
拉丁文學名﹕


Polyporus 
        umbellatus（Pers.）Fries
Grifola 
        Umbellata (pers.ex.fr) pilat.




Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕


chorei




Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕


cheyyong






        Pron. in Cantonese:
粵音﹕


zyu1  
        ling4




Other Names:
別名﹕


zhi ling 知 
        苓﹐zhu ling 朱苓﹐tun yao 豕橐﹐
ye xhu shi 
        野豬屎﹐di wu tao 地烏桃,
feng shu ling 
        楓樹苓, hei zhu fen 黑猪粪。




Common Name:
英文名﹕


agaric, umbellate 
        pore fungus, polyporus sclerotium.




Distribution:
產地﹕


Mainly produced 
        in Shaanxi, Hebei, Yunnan provinces.
主產於中國陝西﹐河北 
        ﹐雲南等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕


sweet, bland, 
        neutral.
甘﹐淡，平。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕


kidney, bladder.
歸腎﹐膀胱經。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 


1. diuretic 
        effect: hypodermic injection on white mice and
white rats 
        or the water decoction of this herb did not have
diuretic 
        effect.[1]
2. the diuretic 
        effect is from the chemical ingredient ergone,
which can 
        vary from habitat to habitat [2]
3. anti tumor 
        effect  hot water decoction of this herb possesses anti murine 
        cancer cell line S-180. Its main effective ingredient is β -1, 
        3-glucan
4. anti 
        HBV effect. The anti HBV effect is stronger when combine with
        dan shen [3]
 
 1.利 
        尿 作 用 -- 本 品 水 抽 取 物 對 小 白 鼠 或 大 白 鼠 經 口 給 藥 或 皮 下
注 射 無 利 尿 
        作 用 。【1】
2. 利尿作用的化學成份麥角酰胺，因產地不同而含量相差很大 
        【2】
3. 抗 腫 瘍 作 
        用 -- 本 品 熱 水 抽 取 物 對 小 白 鼠 有 抗 肉 瘤 S-180 作 用 ， 主 要 作 用 成 分 為 β -1, 3-聚 葡 
        糖 ( β -1, 3-glucan ) 。 【1】
4. 
        抗乙型肝炎病毒；如配合丹參其抗乙型肝炎病毒的作用會增強【3】




Actions & Indications:
主治﹕


for edema, 
        edema caused by pyelitis, difficulty in urination, painful urination, acute 
        inflammation of the urethra, leukorrhea, thirst due to heat type of sickness, 
        diarrhea.

水腫，腎盂炎水腫，小便不利，尿痛，急性尿道炎， 糖尿病，白濁帶下，熱性病口渴，泄瀉。




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕


麥角酰胺 (ergone)
麥角固醇 ( 
        ergosterol )
α - 羥基廿 
        四醇酸 ( α - hydroxy-tetracosanoic acid )
生物素 ( biotin 
        )
多糖類  
        (polysacharin)
蛋白質 (protein)




Dosage:
用量﹕


10 to 20 
        g. Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
10～20公克 
        ；濃縮中藥：0.5～2公 
        克。




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕

        san 五苓散

zhu ling san 豬苓散

        。其含量由2.13�0.02 to 59.17�0.05 痢/g.[2]

do not use

Botanical: Leonurus sibiricus LF albiflora (Nakai & Kitagawa) G. Y. Wu et H. W. Li

Preparation: Dosage: 9 ~ 30 g. Long-term or large dosages can be toxic to the kidneys.
Contraindications: Not to use in case of blood deficient and in cases without blood stasis or during pregnancy. Long-term usage can be toxic to the kidneys.
Notes: Chong wei zi (茺蔚子) is the seeds of the plant and is sweet and slightly cold. It is being used as the plant and can be used to cool the liver.

Distribution:

Originally it was from south and southeastern 
        Asia, east Africa. It is now being culivated in Hainan, Yunnan, Fujian, 
        Taiwan provinces of China,原産亞洲南部與東南部與非洲東部。現在中國的海南，雲南，福建，台灣也有栽培。

characteristics﹕

bitter, acrid, warm.苦，辛，溫。

For treatment of glaucoma: use betel nut pieces 
        and made into 1:1 eye drops, 1 drop every 5 minutes, a total of six times; 
        with the shield 30 minutes, 3 times; after 1 drop every 2 hours according 
        to the disease. Control of intraocular pressure in the normal range, drops 
        2-3 times daily 1-2 drops each time, to prevent recurrence. Acute and chronic 
        glaucoma miosis, lowering intraocular pressure. It is better than pilocarpine 
        in control of intraocular pressure , and compared to using pilocarpine, 
        the duration of the miotic effect is shorter. The irritation is slightly 
        stronger than the pilocarpine and causes mild pain and conjunctival hyperemia, 
        and the side effect completely disappear after a few minutes. 
For treatment

bake bing 
        lang and make into powder. Use 7.5 grams per serving. Take with decoction

治療青光眼：
用檳榔片制成 1∶1滴 
        眼液，每5分鐘滴1次，共6次；隨後 每30分鐘1次，共3次；以後按病情每2小時滴1次。眼壓控制在正常范圍後，每日滴2-3次，每次1-2滴，以防復 
        發。對急慢性青光眼有縮瞳、降眼壓作用。控制眼壓效果較毛果芸香鹼為優，而縮瞳作用比毛果芸香鹼維持時間短。刺激性較毛果芸香鹼稍大，一般點藥後均有輕度 
        疼痛和結膜充血，幾分鐘後可完全消失。
 
治諸虫在臟腑久不

檳榔半兩(炮)為 
        末。每用二錢，以蔥蜜煎湯調服。 [2]

Maladies Treated: Fullness in the uterus due to accumulation of blood
Preparation: Use 3 - 9 g in decoction. 3 g can be taken as powder form.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yin deficiency with heat, also in cases of weakness after stroke-like types of sickness.
Research: Demonstrated anti-inflammatory effects, analgesic effects, and anticonvulsant effects in animal studies.
Notes: Serves as a remedy in traditional medicine for various conditions including chronic eczema and urticaria.

Preparation: Dosage: 3 to 9 g.
Contraindications: Persimmons contain tannin acid. If eaten with high protein food like meat or fish, the protein can be hardened and form tannin albumate, making it difficult to digest. In some individuals, it can lead to constipation. People with a cold type of body (yang deficient) should avoid consuming them. Overconsumption can cause stercolith (fecal stones) in the intestines, leading to constipation or even gastro intestinal perforation.
Research: There is little research on the polyphenols of persimmon in the West because it is not a popular food item among Westerners.
Notes: The white powder on the surface of the dried persimmons sold are usually titanium oxide added during processing. The naturally occurring white powder during the drying process does not fall off easily.

Toxicity & Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕
Persimmons contain tannin acid. If eaten with high protein food like meat or fish, the protein can be hardened and can form tannin albumate and is difficult to digest. In some people it can create constipation.
Because persimmons are cold in characteristics, people with cold type of body (yang deficient) should avoid eating them.
Over consumption of persimmons can cause stercolith (fecal stones) in the intestines [2]. Stercolith can cause constipation or even can cause gastro intestine perforation.[1]
Note: there is little research on the 
      polyphenols of persimmon in the West because it is not a popular food item 
      among the Westerners.柿子含鞣酸如與肉類一起食用，會產生一種鞣酸蛋白，使得肉類裡的蛋白質凝固而不易消化。甚至會產生便秘。柿子性寒性，體質偏寒(陽
      虛)者忌吃。
吃柿子太多會引起糞石【2】。糞石能導致便秘，甚至能貫穿腸胃。【1】
注: 在西方，對柿子之多酚類的研究難見到，因為柿子在西方不是主要的食物。[1] J Coll Physicians Surg Pak. 2012 Jul;22(7):455-7. doi: 07.2012/JCPSP.455457.[2]  Source: Chen Xuanwei, director of Pediatrics ofTaizhong city (Taiwan) Hospital,資料來源：台中市陳鉉煒小兒科院長（作者亦為新生兒科專科醫師) Note:The white powder on the surface of the dried persimmons sold are usually titanium oxide added to the the fruit during processing. Preparation: 3 - 9 g daily, add water to make into concoction. One prescription a day, make into 3 servings.
Contraindications: Use with care during pregnancies and in cases of eye disease without blood stasis.
Research: Total effectiveness of herbal treatment for cataracts was found to be 98.4% in a study with 200 patients.
Notes: The weight of the herbs must be adjusted according to diagnosis.

Maladies Treated: chronic ache in loin and knees
weakness in knees and feet of the aged
late development of teeth in small children
over abundance of bleeding during menses
heat in blood with bleeding not during menses
dark purple pieces of blood during menses
Preparation: Internal use: 10 to 24 g in decoction. Suitable to roast in sand. If using raw shells, boil before other herbs. External use: char and retain property. Grind into powder and apply on affected area.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yangxu (yang deficient) or pixu (spleen deficient); not to use in cases of cold/flu infection not yet cleared; use with care during pregnancies; not to use in patients who are weak and without fever. The herb is cold and can reduce yang qi.
Research: Modern research indicates that the herb improves function of anti-cancer ability.
Notes: Gui ban jiao is more concentrated and stronger than gui ban. It is the gelatin obtained by prolonged cooking of tortoise shell.
Chemical Ingredients: inorganic ions: K+, Na+, Ca2+, Fe3+, P

Common: Japanese apricot flower with green calyx

Maladies Treated: Stomachache caused by dominant liver qi
Preparation: Daily dosage: 3 ~ 6 g
Contraindications: Long term usage are not suitable for those who are yinxu (yin deficient) with serious sickness, accompanied with red tongue without fur, dry mouth, and preferring cold drink.
Notes: The variety that has green calyx is called lu e mei, literally means apricot (flowers) with green calyx. In the classics Ben Cao Gang Mu it is called bai hua mei, literally means white flower plum.

Preparation: Oral: 10 - 30 ml in decoction, or soaking, or mix with other food items. External use: appropriate amount. Rinsing in the mouth, or mix with other herb and apply, or use in steaming or washing.
Contraindications: Use with care if dampness is heavy, the body is weak and muscles are in atrophy, or spastic, or during the early stage of cold or influenza.
Research: Vinegar has insecticidal effects, demonstrated through in vitro tests with acetic acid leading to rapid mortality in protoscolex and exhibits antibacterial and antiviral effects against various pathogens.
Notes: Protoscolex is the larval form of the tapeworm parasite of the genus Echinococcus. Hydatid is a cyst due to infection by larvae of some species of the tapeworm Echinococcus.

In 5-10 minutes 100% were killed. Using protoscolex that had been treated with acetic acid for 10 minutes to intraperitoneal inoculate to mice and did not develop into hydatid disease.2. antibacterial, antiviral effect: acetic acid have a good bacteriostatic and bactericidal effect on Streptococcus, Branhamella (Neisseria) catarrhalis, Streptococcus pneumoniae, Staphylococcus, influenza virus and other pathogens.1.殺虫作用 體外試驗，0.125%-0.25%乙酸與原頭蚴接觸後可在2-3 分鐘內出 現皮層起泡，起刺，皮層分離，溶解及虫體發暗，鈣粒減少等形態結構變化。5-10 分鐘內可達到100%殺死原頭蚴的效果。原頭蚴經藥液處理10 分鐘後 ，給小鼠腹腔接種，均未發育成棘球坳。2.抗菌、抗病毒作用 乙酸對甲型鏈球菌、卡他球菌、肺炎鏈球菌、白色葡萄球菌、流感病毒等 致病菌，有很好的抑菌和殺菌作用。Actions & Indications:主治﹕getting rid of blood stasis and improving digestion. rid of roundworms; detoxification. For treatment of postpartum dizziness; lumps in abdomen; vomiting; epistaxis; blood in stool; parasitic abdominal pain; food poisoning; carbuncle and swollen sores散淤消 積；止血；安蛔；解毒。主產後血暈；症瘕積聚；吐血；衄血；便血；虫積腹痛；魚肉菜毒；癰腫瘡毒Chemical ingredients: [2]化學成份﹕【2】 Vinegar contains:醋含；acetic acid, 3%-5%乙酸 3%-5%higher alcohol高級醇類acetoin3-羥基丁酮dihydroxyacetone二羥基丙酮tyrosol酪醇acetaldehyde乙醛formaldehyde甲醛acetal乙縮醛succinic acid琥珀酸oxalic acid草酸sorbose山梨糖Click here to see cider vinegar chemical ingredients in USDA site. Dosage:用 量﹕oral: 10 - 30 ml. in decoction, or soaking or mix with other food items.external use: appropriate amount. Rinsing in the mouth, or mix with other herb and apply, or use in steaming or washing.內服：煎湯，10-30 毫升；或浸漬；或拌制。外用：適量，含漱；或調藥敷；或熏蒸；或浸洗。Samples of formulae:處方舉 例﹕For treatment of tumor：bi jie, he zi peel, gan jiang. Equal amount of each. Grind into powder. Mix with starch glue made with vinegar. Make into pills, sizes like soy beans. Take orally 30 pills each time with drinking water during empty stomachFish bone lodged in throat 治 瘕症：鱉 甲、訶 子皮、乾 薑各等分。為末，醋糊丸，梧子大，每服三十丸，空心白湯下。（《醫學入門》 醋鱉丸）魚骨梗喉嚨Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Use with care if dampness is heavy, the body is weak and muscles are in atrophy, or spastic, or during the early stage of cold or influenza.[2]脾胃濕 重， 身體痿弱，肌肉萎縮、筋脈攣 或外感初起者慎服。[2]Note:Protoscolex is the larval form of the tapeworm parasite of the genus Echinococcus. Hydatid is a cyst due to infection by larvae of some species of the tapeworm Echinococcus. [1] Zhong Hua Ben Cao   中華本草[2] Zhong Yao Da Ci Dian 中藥大 辭典 Problems with website? Preparation: Typical dosage is 6-10 g daily, but above 30 g is recommended for hypertension. Smaller dosages can have a hypertensive effect.
Contraindications: Not to be used in liver yang ascending type of hypertension, acute infections like cold or flu, boils, skin ulcers, yin deficiency with fever, or digestive tract infections. Some varieties are toxic. Rare cases may cause skin rash, especially in patients with spleen deficiency or kidney yang deficiency.
Research: Large dosages (above 35 grams) can lower blood pressure with vaso-dilation effects. Small dosages (within 15 grams) can increase blood pressure, prolong diuretic effects, lessen proteinuria, improve endurance, protect liver function, and regulate blood sugar. Astragaloside IV has potent anti-HBV activity.
Notes: Smaller pieces of the herb are preferred over larger ones; wild roots are considered the best due to distinctive fibers.

Small dosage and can have hypertensive effect.6～10 克。治 療高血壓時，其用量一般在30克 以上。剤量小有生壓作用。Samples of formulae:Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang 補中益氣湯﹐Shi Quan Da Bu Tang 十全大補湯,Gui Pi Tang 歸脾 湯,Yu Ping Feng San, 玉屏風散Modern Research:現代研究：(more to upload)Quality：質量：Usually the smaller pieces are better than the large, wider pieces.The larger pieces can be either reconstituted from the little pieces or made from the smaller roots that has been soaked in water and mechanically pressed into wider pieces. Some are toxic. The varieties used in Chinese herbal medicine is relatively safe but in rare cases it might cause skin rash, especially in patients with pixu (spleen deficient)   and serious shenyangxu (kidney yang deficient) conditions.It cannot be used in liver yang ascending type of hypertension but can be use in qi deficient and blood deficient type of hypertension.Huang qi is a strong tonic and can raise the function of the body, thus it is not suitable to use in acute infections, like cold or flu,  boils, skin ulcers, yin deficient with fever, digestive tract infection.不能用於 肝陽上亢所引起的高血壓。但可以用於氣 虛與血虛型 的血壓高。而由於黃耆溫補升陽之力甚強。不宜用於是表實邪盛、熱毒瘡瘍、 陰虛身熱、積滯痞滿 、肝陽上亢者。黃芪有多種。有些有毒 。 中藥用的種類是相當安全的，但在很少情形下曾有發生皮疹, 尤其是脾 虛與 腎陽虛患 者。 [1] Biol Pharm Bull 32(1):132-5 (2009), PMID 19122295 If you need more information in a hurry, you can email our research librarian.Search this siteProblems with website? Maladies Treated: Vomiting or burping with undigested food
Preparation: Flowers for decoction 3 to 5 g. For external application: use appropriate amount. Root: 1.5 g to 9 g in pills or in powder form.
Contraindications: The bulb and the flowers have been known to cause dermatitis in sensitive people, though up to 5 bulbs a day can be eaten without ill effect. It can cause diarrhea in some people if eaten too much.
Research: Alcohol extract of leaves and stems possess inhibiting effect on Bacillus cereus and bacillus mycoides.
Notes: Toxicity can be an issue; it's generally safe to consume up to 5 bulbs a day.

Preparation: Wu mei dosage: 3 to 9 g; Lu e mei dosage: 3 to 4.5 g.
Contraindications: Do not use wu mei in cases of internal heat excess (high fever with infection) and stagnation or unresolved exterior disorders. Using wu mei together with sulfonamides may cause bleeding in the urinary tract.
Research: To be loaded.
Notes: Wu mei (black prunes) are collected before they are almost ripe and baked. Bai mei (white prunes) are unripe plums pickled in salt water and dried. Lu e mei are the flowers of the plant with green calyx. Uses include dispersing liver stagnation, calming the stomach, and treating globus hystericus.
Original Text:
wu mei, lu e mei, bai mei, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

        綠萼梅    
        
 By: 
        Joe Hing Kwok Chu




Pharmaceutical name:

Fructus 
            Armeniaca mume





Biological name:

Armeniaca 
            mume Sieb.

 u bai

閩南語 發音

Common 
            Name:
英文名 ：


 plum, 
            Japanese apricot, mume fruit




Distribution:
分佈：


Originated 
            in China. Produced in Sichuan, zhejiang, Guangdong, Fujian, Hunan, Guizhou. 
            Those produced in Changxin  (長新) of Zhejiang is deemed best.

原産於中國 。産於四川， 浙江， 廣東，福建，湖南，貴州。浙江長新出産的被認為最好。




Properties 
            (characteristics)：
性味：



Sour. Warm
酸，温。





Channels (meridians) entered:
歸經：



large intestine, liver, lung, spleen
大腸，肝， 
            肺，脾。





Actions & Indications:
主治：



relieving coughs, diarrhea, pain from colic 
            caused by ascaris, alleviates thirst caused by 
            yin deficient,  rid of ascaris worms, stopping bleeding, treating 
            corns and warts (external use),
用於肺虛久 
            咳不止﹐久瀉久痢﹐虛熱口渴﹐蛔蟲所致的嘔吐腹痛, 外用於皮膚疣。




Medical 
            Function:
药理：



antibiotic effect on Staphylococcus. Stimulates 
            the production of bile and induce contraction of bile duct which promote 
            getting rid of round worms in the bile duct. Treatment of hook worms. 
            Anti allergic effect of albumen shock of lab guinea pigs.
對金黄球菌 
            有抗生素作用。刺激胆汁之産生。引起膽管之收缩而帮助排出膽 
            管中的蛔虫。治鉤虫。對試驗室的 天竺鼠有 
            抗蛋白休克過敏反應。
 





Chemical ingredients:
化學成 份：



Vaporizing ingredient: n-hexanal, trans-2-hexenal, 
            n-hexanol, trans-2-hexen-1-ol, cis-2-hexen-1-ol, linalool, a-terpineol, 
            geraniol, trimethyltetrahydronaphthalene drivs, tetradecanoic acid, 
            benzaldehyde, terpinen-4-ol, benzylalcohol, hexandecanoic acid 
            (1). b-sitosterol.

Lipids: neutral lipids,
            glycolipids, 
            phospholipids, triglycerides, free sterols, sterol esters, 1, 2; 1,2 
            -glycerides, free fatty acid, ceryl alcohol, pectic acid.

Simple acids: citric acid, malic acid, succinic 
            acid(5-7), oxalic acid, fumaric acid (2), hydrocyanic 
            acid.

Amino acid: aspartic acid, asparagine, serine, 
            glycine, alanine, glycinamide.

Others: lup-20-(29)-ene, 7b, 15a-diol-3b-palmitate, 
            stearate, arahidate, behenate, lignocerate (7); rhamnocitrin-3-O-rhamnoside,  
            kaempferol-3-O-rhamnoside, quercetin-3-O-rhamnoside (7) ;  
            amygdalin, b-glucosidase (3), superoxide dismutase(9), 
            gibberellin A32 .

Cautions:
禁忌：


Do not 
            use wu mei  in cases of internal heat excess (high fever with infection) 
            and stagnation or unresolved exterior disorders, (as in cold or flu 
            without sweat).
Using 
            wu mei together with sulfonamides may cause bleeding in the urinary 
            tract.
烏梅酸澀收斂 
            ，凡有表邪，或內有實熱積滯者，不宜服用。
烏梅與磺胺類藥 (sulfonamides)
            同時使用可能會引起血尿。



Wu mei (literally means black 
        prunes): the plums are collected before they 
        are almost ripe and baked in low heat  till 
        brown in color and are covered until they turned black.
Bai mei (literally means white 
        prunes): the green (unripe) plums are collected and pickled in salt water, 
        then dried under the sun, which turns them white.
Lu e mei 
        : The flowers are being used. The variety that has 
        green calyx is called lu e mei, literally means plum (flowers) with green 
        calyx.
Uses: to disperse liver stagnation, to calm stomach, 
        to transform phlegm, treat globus hystericus (sensation 
        of a lump in the throat), lack of appetite.
Dosage: 3 to 4.5 g
 
 
Wu mei  was incorrectly listed by Chinese 
        medicine Dictionary 中華人民共和國藥典.  Now has been corrected and listed as
        Armeniaca mume Sieb.)
烏梅﹕五月立夏前後梅 果 
        將成熟，採集後 以低溫焙至呈黃褐色，再悶至黑色。
青梅﹕梅果未成熟尚青， 
        採集後以鹽醃，日晒曝乾，是為白梅 。
綠萼梅即綠 
        萼梅花的含苞花蕾，綠萼花白，稱之為綠萼梅。
        其作用為疏肝，和胃，化痰，治梅核氣，肝胃氣痛，食欲不振，眩暈。
用量：3 ～ 4.5 克。


註﹕
烏梅，梅花（梅）
        原文：Prunus mume（Sieb.）Sieb. et Zucc.（61，268页）
        補正：Armeniaca mume Sieb.
        注解：本種為杏屬（Armeniaca）植物，而《藥典》所採用的本種屬名（Prunus），現為李屬的屬名。《藥典》所載其學名為異名。　(沈保安﹐ 
        安徽省芜湖市药品检验所 241001)

Preparation: Taking orally: 30-60 g in decoction or in pills or powder form.
Contraindications: Do not use with alcohol.
Research: Water-based extracts of three mushroom species, Coprinellus sp., Coprinus comatus, Flammulina velutipes were identified as novel anti-breast cancer agents.
Notes: Use as vegetable in stir fry with other vegetables, with meat or soup.

Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 9 g. For external use: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and make into paste and apply to affected areas.
Contraindications: Use with care in cases of weak digestion. Not to use where there is no blood stasis, or in cases of where boils have ripened and ulcerated or in cases of pregnancies.
Research: The petroleum ether extract of the oleo-gum resin of Commiphora molmol, at a dose of 500 mg/kg body weight, produced significant inhibition of carrageenan induced inflammation and cotton pellet granuloma. The extract also showed significant antipyretic activity in mice.
Notes: Myrrh is often used in combinations with other herbs to enhance its efficacy.

Preparation: For constipation or mild intestine obstruction, mix 12 g of zao jiao ci and 12 g of xi xin into powder with 120 g honey to make a suppository, insert into anus while warm.
Contraindications: Do not overdose. Large amounts can induce vomiting and diarrhea. Do not use during pregnancy or in cases of qi deficiency or yin deficiency, or hemoptysis.
Notes: Past substitutes for zao jiao ci include branches with thorns of Ziziphus jujuba, Sophora japonica, Rosa multiflora, among others.

How to identify fake substitutes： 
            zao jiao ci are from the thorns of the plants Gleditsia sinensis
            Lam. A complete intact piece of herb has a cone shape with a main 
            thorn and 1 or 2 side thorns. The main thorn is about 3 to 15 cm long 
            or slightly longer and has a diameter of 0.3 to 1.2 cm. The side thorns 
            are 1 to 6 cm long, spiraling around the branches and forming a 60 to 
            80� angle with the main thorn; they gradually get thinner as they go 
            up. The surfaces are brown or dark brown in color. The tips are sharp 
            and are mostly dark red in color with vertical lines; they are light 
            in weight and hard (not easily broken). Broken or cut surfaces reveal 
            a yellowish white color under the surface. The middle part of the herb 
            is not dense and has a light reddish brown color; it is without smell 
            and bland in taste.

偽品鑒別﹕皂角刺係豆科植物皂角(Gleditsia 
            sinensis Lam)的干燥棘刺。完整棘刺呈圆錐形，有主刺及1～2分枝刺。主刺長3～15cm，或更長，直徑0.3～1.2cm，
            分枝刺長1～6cm，螺旋形排列與主刺成60～80�夾角，由下向上逐漸細小，刺尖銳利。表面紫棕色或棕褐色。尖部多顯深紅色，有細縱紋。體輕質 
            堅硬，不易折斷，斷面或切斷面木部黃白色，髓部疏鬆，淡紅棕色。無臭，味淡。 
 

In the past, the main substitute 
            for zao jiao ci were: branches with thorn of  Ziziphus jujuba 
            Mill, Sophora japonica L., Rosa multiflora Thunb., 
            Vitex negundo,  L.var heterophylla (Franch) Rehd.,
            Paliurus ramosissimus Poir., Rubus coreanus. The 
            most commonly mixed in are the branches of Gleditsia melanacantha. 
            The most recent fake product is Gleditsia heterophylla Bunge. 
            Also the quality of the herb is also a serious issue, like mixing in 
            large amount of dry branches without thorns and the herb are not up 
            the processing standard. [2]

皂角刺過去的主要混偽品有鼠李科植物酸棗（Ziziphus jujuba Mill），喜科植物槐樹（Sophora japonica 
            L.)，蔷薇科植物多花蔷薇（Rosa multiflora Thunb.），馬鞭草科植物刻葉黄荆（Vitex negundo 
            L.var heterophylla (Franch) Rehd.)，鼠李科植物馬甲子（Paliurus ramosissimus 
            Poir.)，和插田泡(Rubus coreanus)等一些带刺的枝條，但混入最多的是同科属的山皂角刺(Gleditsia
            melanacantha)，近年新出偽品 為野皂角刺(Gleditsia.heterophylla Bunge.)，
            并且質量問題嚴重，如混入較多的枯枝茎，無刺枝茎，另外飲片切制規格不符的也不少。

[2] (錄自﹕第四軍醫大學藥物研究所﹔中藥 正品 與
偽品 的鑒別方法

Maladies Treated: tuberculosis of lymph nodes of the neck
Preparation: Usually not used in decoction. Being used in pills or powder form. For adult: 1.5～5g (stir fried semen). External application: use appropriate amount.
Contraindications: The estimated lethal dose in man is 1 mg/kg; two to four seeds may cause severe poisoning in an adult, and 8 are generally fatal. If seeds are swallowed without chewing, poisoning is unlikely. Children: One to three seeds can be fatal. Poisoning reaction: intense gastroenteritis and acute dehydration. Renal and hepatic insufficiency have been reported.

Maladies Treated: Painful cold lower back and knees
Preparation: 6-15 g of the herb is used. Often steeped in wine for effects on kidney yang deficiency. Traditionally prepared by stir frying with goat fat.
Contraindications: Contraindicated in patients with fire from yin deficiency. It should not be taken as a decoction for prolonged periods as it can damage the yin. Possible side effects include dizziness, vomiting, dry mouth, thirst, and nose bleeding.
Research: Research indicates that it improves the endocrine system, DNA metabolism, immune system, and has anti-aging properties. It also promotes blood flow and prevents platelet coagulation.
Notes: Often used in traditional Chinese medicine for various ailments including impotence and menopausal symptoms.

陜西，遼寧，山西，湖北，四川。Properties (characteristics)：性味：
Acrid, sweet, warm
辛，苷，溫。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經：
Kidney, Liver
入 肝 ﹐ 腎 經Actions & Indications:主治：
Tonifies the kidneys and fortifies the yang: for shenyangxu (kidney yang deficient) patterns with such symptoms as impotence, spermatorrhea, frequent urination , forgetfulness, withdrawal, and painful cold lower back and knees.
Expels wind-damp-cold: for wind-damp-cold painful obstruction (pain and water retention) with such symptoms as spasms or cramps in the hands and feet, joint pain, and numbness in the extremities due to bad circulation.
Tonifies the yin and yang and harnesses liver yang ascending, for lower back pain, dizziness, and menstrual irregularity from deficiency of liver and kidneys (shenxu) and subsequent causes liver yang ascending, (gan yang).
Hypertension during menopause.陽 萎 早 泄，腰膝痿弱， 風濕痺痛，筋骨攣急，半身不遂，神經衰弱，健忘症, 肝 陽 上 昇﹐婦 女 更 年 期 高 血 壓 。Medical Function[2]:藥理：【2】

  火上炎者: 二 仙 湯更年期綜合症 而有肝腎 陰虛癥狀或肝陽上亢者 ：仙靈脾加 仙茅, 黃柏 ,  知母陽痿，不孕腎虛：仙靈脾加五味子,  枸杞子   沙苑蒺藜下肢癱瘓，疼痛，肌肉抽 搐，肢端麻木：仙靈脾加桑寄生Today's Usage:
1. For impotence:
A. Use yin yang huo 15 g. with tu si zi15 g. Grind into powder. 5 g a day in  3 servings. To be taken with yellow rice wine. 20 days is one treatment.  Take every day first thing in morning and before bed.  Massage the perineal area from left to right and right to left about 10 times .
B.  Every night use chuan xiong 15 g and xi xin 15 g. Boil a decoction and put in bathtub and sit for 20 minutes. Avoid intercourse for 100 days. Avoid over exertion and getting chilled. 7 days is one treatment.
Total cases: 38. 8 cases got better. 20 cases completely healed. After 2 years, no patients had recurring problems. Total effectiveness: 92 per cent.
2. For white patches of vagina.
3. For neurasthenia .
4. For coronary disease.
5. For viral infections of the heart muscle.

Often steeped in wine for both kidney yang deficiency and painful obstruction.  Traditional preparation by stir frying with fat of goat is an effective method. Although stir frying with goat fat does not increase the total saponin in the leaves but the total saponin that dissolves by boiling in water increases; thus , improve the efficacy of the herb.
This herb improves the quality of life and cellular immunity in patients of hemodialysis maintenance.Cautions:注意﹕
Contraindicated in patients with fire from yin deficiency.  This herb should not be taken as a decoction, over prolonged periods. This herb can damage the yin. In some people, ingesting it can lead to dizziness, vomiting, dry mouth, thirst, and nose bleeding.
This herb from Japan can increase the activity of lab mice and causes hyper-reflexia even mild spasm. Very large doses can cause respiratory arrest.
陰虚有火者不適用。不可長期作湯剤服用以免傷陰。有些人服仙靈脾後可導致頭晕，嘔吐，口乾，口渴，流鼻血。
日產仙靈脾(淫羊藿) 能致反射亢進甚至痙攣。大劑量可致呼吸停止。 【1】Bensky and Gamble.

Last update: June 2, 2015; 9 a..m. 
        LAH

Maladies Treated: Bleeding in the uterus not during menses
Preparation: E jiao is taken on an empty stomach (at least one hour before or three hours after a meal). For chronic ulcerative colitis, e jiao is softened in hot water, cut into pieces and delivered via anus tube. For insomnia, it is used in a formula with other herbs.
Contraindications: Do not use when there is blood stasis, weak digestion, or external syndrome such as cold or flu. It is contraindicated in cases of diarrhea.
Research: E jiao improves red cell count, corrects hypotension, increases stress resistance in laboratory mice, enhances muscle strength in malnourished guinea pigs, improves calcium absorption in laboratory dogs, boosts immune system, and aids kidney inflammation.
Notes: E jiao should be soaked in rice wine to rid of gamey smell before use. It is commonly combined with cattail pollen for its therapeutic effects.

e jiao, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

Maladies Treated: Infection of urinary tract with bleeding
Preparation: For decoction: 10 to 15 g. Double the amount if using fresh herb. Do not over cook. External application: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply to affected areas.
Contraindications: Use caution when using the charcoal preparation, as it can be stronger in its properties to arrest bleeding.
Research: Modern studies indicate that xiao ji can effectively arrest bleeding and has inhibitory effects on various bacteria.
Notes: After being charred, the property of arresting bleeding is stronger.

MB; Cephanoplos setosum (Willd.) Kitarn.Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕shokeiPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕ Pron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕siu2 ga3Other Names:別名﹕ci er cai 刺兒菜，ci ji 刺薊，Common Name:英文名﹕thistle root, thistle leaves.Distribution:產地﹕Produced in most part of China.全國大部分地 區均產。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕sweet, bitter, cool.甘，苦，涼。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕heart, liver.歸心，肝經。Medical functions:藥理﹕ Arrests bleeding: the herb can constrict blood vessels, increase platelet count, promote platelet coagulation, increase the activity of zymoplasm, inhibit fibrinolysis and rapidly stop bleeding.Inhibits bacteria: in vitro: experiments show that the decoction  can inhibit  Staphylococcus aureus,  Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Corynebacterium diphtheriae, pneumococcus, cholerae,  Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica serovar TyphiLowers lipidsPromotes gall excretionPromotes urinationEnhance cardiac functionIncrease blood pressure能收縮血管，升高血小板數目，促進血小板聚集及增高凝血酶活性，抑制纖溶，從而加速止血。體外實驗表明，小薊煎劑對白喉杆菌，肺炎球菌，溶 血性鏈球菌，金黃色葡萄球菌，綠膿杆菌，變形杆菌，大腸杆菌，傷寒杆菌等有一定的抑制作用。此外，本品尚能降脂，利膽，利尿，強心，升壓等。Actions & Indications:主治﹕Taking it raw or as decoction can arrest bleeding.Being used in vomiting bleed, nose bleeding, hematuria (blood in urine), infection of urinary tract with bleeding, hematochezia (blood in stool),  menorrhagia (abnormally heavy or extended menstrual flow).It is also beneficial for acute infectious hepatitis.煮湯或生食有止血作用。用於血熱妄動以及症見吐血，衄血，尿血，血淋，便血，血崩等，均可作輔助食療，對高血壓，急性傳染性肝炎亦有一定療效。外用：搗爛外敷，治疔，瘡，癰，疽等腫毒及外傷出血。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕Alkaloids, flavonoids  (hispidulin-7-neohesperidoside , linarin, pectolinarin and luteolin 木犀草素), triterpenoid, and simple phenolic acidsIts ingredients that arrest bleeding are: acacetin-7--dirhamnoside,  rutin, caffeic acid, chlorogenic acid, protocatechuic aldehyde, and  taraxasterol.主要含生物鹼，黃酮 ( 剛毛黃酮-7 -新橙皮糖苷， 蒙花甙，大薊苷，木犀草素)，三萜以及簡單酚酸。其中止血活性成分 有刺槐素-7-鼠李糖苷，芸香苷 （蘆丁），咖啡酸，綠原酸，原兒茶醛以及蒲公英甾醇等。Dosage:用量﹕For decoction: 10 to 15 g. Double the amount if using fresh herb. Do not over cook.External application: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply to affected areas.煎服，10～15g， 鮮品加倍。不可久煎。外用適量，搗敷患處。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕Bleeding after gastrectomy:  using xiao ji 30 g,  800 ml of water. Simmered down to 200 ml. Used on 11 patients. Result was satisfactory. [1]Stubborn insomnia: using  dry herb 6 g or fresh herb 10 g. Pour 30 to 50 ml of boiling water and soak ed for 10 minutes, using it before bed, 2 months as one therapy period, on 56 patients, produced good result and no undesirable side effect.. [2]治療胃切除術後出血: 用小薊30g，加水800ml，煎取200ml，灌胃。11例，療效滿意（浙江中醫雜誌，2001，7，285） ；頑固性失眠：用小薊干品6g或鮮品10g放入杯中，用開水30～50ml浸泡10分鐘，睡前服，療程2個月。共治療56例， 療效確切，無不良反應（山東中醫雜誌，1995，9：14）。臨床以本品為主，還可預防菌痢，治療高血壓，傳染性肝炎，外傷感染，麻風性鼻衄，產 後子宮收縮不全及血崩等。Modern Study:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Xiao ji tan: Literally means charcoal of xiao ji. Put clean xiao ji sections into a wok. Stir fry in high heat till about 70% is charred and with sparks. Turn off heat. Spray with some water to put off the sparks. Take out and let sit to cool. After being charred, the property of arresting bleeding is stronger.小薊炭: 取淨小薊 段置炒藥鍋內，用武火加熱翻炒至表面約七成顯炭黑色，存性，並見有火星，噴淋少許清水，滅淨火星，微炒干，取出攤晾。炒炭後可增強其止血的作用。 [1] Zhejiang Chinese Medical Journal, July, 2001, p 295. 浙江中醫雜誌，2001，7，285[2] Shandong Chinese Medical Journal,  Sept 1995, p 14. 山東中醫雜誌，1995，9：14  Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressProblems with website? Preparation: Oral: for decoction 9 to 15 g. External application: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply or wash with decoction.
Contraindications: Huang shui qie is toxic. Overdose can cause dry mouth, thirst, difficulty in swallowing, fever, dry skin, redness, dilated pupils, blurry vision and other symptoms. If poisoning is severe, it can cause respiratory, circulatory inhibition and even respiratory failure and result in death.
Research: Modern research indicates toxicity and cautions related to overdose.

Preparation: Oral consumption: decoction, 15 ~ 30 g, or fresh herb 60 ~ 120 g; or make into the powder or make into juice and mix with honey for oral consumption or for gargling. External use: appropriate amount, washed, smashed apply topically or with decoction; or sun dry and make into powder and apply as paste; or make into topical creams, or face cream and apply.
Contraindications: The Panel on Dietetic Products, Nutrition and Allergies of European Food Safety Authority concludes that Morinda citrifolia (Noni) fruit puree and concentrate as novel food ingredients under the specified conditions are considered safe for the general population. However, there are reported sensitivities for hepatotoxic effects in some individuals and it is listed by the U.S. FDA as toxic.
Research: In vitro tests show that the ethanol extract of noni leaves has a good effect in getting rid of human roundworm. Noni fruit juice has a protective role in acute liver damage. Noni fruit juice increases interferone γ levels in mice, indicating immunomodulatory effects.
Notes: Modern research indicates potential effects on liver health and raises caution for those with renal dysfunction or those consuming noni products.

      的海島地在台灣，分佈 於恆春半島、澎湖七美嶼、綠島及蘭嶼等地的海岸森林內。[1]Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, cold.味苦，性寒。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕Medical functions:藥理﹕ 1 in vitro tests, the ethanol extract of noni leaves showed that  there was good effect in getting rid of human roundworm as an  anthelmintics 2 hepatoprotective effect: noni fruit juice has a  protective role in acute liver damage (CCl4-induced liver  injury  in female Sprague-Dawley (SD) rats).  3 immunomodulatory effects: noni fruit juice to mice in vivo and  in vitro experiments, continuous oral 16 days, increase the interferone γ  (IFN-gamma) levels, and its mechanism is CB2 receptor activation and inhibitionof IL-4 role.1.海巴戟嫩葉中的乙醇提取物，體外試驗表明，對人蛔蟲有良好的驅腸蟲作用。 2.保肝作用：檄樹果汁具有保護急性肝受損作用(CCl4誘發肝損傷，雌性Sprague-Dawley (SD) rats)。 3.免疫調節作用：檄樹果汁體內與體外實驗給予小鼠，連續口服16天，可增加γ干擾啊素(IFN-gamma)的含量，其機轉是活化CB2受器，並抑制IL-4的作用。  Actions & Indications:主治﹕Upper respiratory tract infection, sore throat, hepatitis, jaundice, damp-heat  dysentery, diarrhea, scalding and burns, swelling of unknown origin, eczema,  gum disease, skin irritation, cellulitis, allergic dermatitis, high blood pressure,  diabetes.上呼吸道感染，咽喉腫痛，肝炎，黃疸型肝炎，濕熱瀉痢，痢疾，湯火燙傷，無名腫毒，濕疹，牙齦糜爛，牙周病，皮膚紅腫，蜂窩組織炎，過敏性皮炎，高血壓，糖尿病。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕根含 (the roots contain):2-甲基-7-羥基-8-甲氧基蒽醌(2-methyl-7-hydroxy-8-methoxy-anthraquinone)，morintrifolins A、B，1,2-dihydroxyanthraquinone，1,3-dihydroxy-2-methylanthraquinone，2-hydroxy-3-(hydroxymethyl)anthraquinone，1,3,6-trihydroxy-2-methylanthraquinone。

Maladies Treated: Impotence due to kidney yang deficiency
Difficulty in conceiving due to weak sexual function
Preparation: Internal use: 3 to 9 g in decoction. External use: use accordingly for washing with decoction or make into powder and use as paste.
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of kidney yin deficiency, liver fire ascending with/or priapism. Some traditional sources state it antagonizes mu dan pi, ba dou, and bei mu.
Research: Modern research indicates that Cnidium monnieri has various pharmacological effects, including cardiovascular and central nervous system activities, as well as potential applications for issues related to impotence and immune function.
Notes: Cnidium monnieri is recognized for its effects on the kidney and has been linked to improving male sexual health and enhancing immune response.

she chuang zi, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

巨細胞病毒是一種疱疹病毒，普通人感染多數無症狀，但孕婦感染常導致流產﹐死胎或死產，活產兒也常出現先天
    性心臟病﹐中樞神經系統畸形以及智力遲鈍等。孕婦巨細胞病毒感染引起的症狀及後果屬於中醫的胎漏﹐滑胎﹐胎萎等范疇。以壽胎丸合四
    君子湯加 減，服藥三劑可止血，再加薏
    苡仁﹐板 
    藍 根﹐貫
    仲﹐蛇
    床子﹐6 克，服藥10劑。

    蛇床子藥理作用 　　
    蛇床子為傘形科植物蛇床的干燥成熟果實，味辛涼，歸腎經，有溫腎助陽、祛風、燥濕、殺虫之功效。蛇床子中研究最多的是有效成分蛇床子總 香豆素（total 
    coumarines），其中單體蛇床子素約佔TCCM的60％，其他單體還有佛手柑內酯、異虎耳草素、花椒毒酚、花椒毒素等。近年來，國內外加強
    了對蛇床子有效成分的藥理研究，發現其作用廣泛。
    　　■對心血管系統作用
    　　擴張血管蛇床子素能使去甲腎上腺素、CaCl2 和高K＋除極化所致的家兔主動脈條收縮抑制，量效曲線右移，最大反應降低。蛇床子素有
    鬆弛血管平滑肌作用，與非競爭性Ca2 
    ＋拮抗有關。由於其化學結構上帶有較強的脂溶性基團，可直接進入細胞內，抑制鈣貯庫中Ca2 
    ＋釋放，認為蛇床子素可通過抑制細胞膜依賴性鈣離子通道（PDC）和細胞內Ca2 
    ＋釋放而發揮鈣拮抗作用，這可能是它擴血管作用的重要機制。
    　　抗心律失常TCCM可降低氯仿誘發的小鼠和CaCl2誘發的大鼠室顫發生率，顯著對抗烏頭鹼誘發的大鼠心律失常，但對腎上腺素（家兔）和氯化鋇（大鼠）誘發的
    心律失常無效。抗心律失常作用可能是通過抑制心肌細胞膜上的Na＋、Ca2 
    ＋內流起作用，而與阻斷β受體無關。
    　　■對中樞神經系統作用
    　　鎮靜作用香豆素類對實驗動物有麻醉和催眠效果。研究表明，給小鼠腹腔注射100毫克/千克總 香豆素，能顯著增強閾下催眠劑量戊巴比妥鈉誘導的睡眠，並能明顯
    提提高 咖啡因小鼠半數致死量（LD50）。
    　　鎮痛作用國外研究蛇床子素能抑制醋酸所致的小鼠扭體反應，對小鼠化學刺激性疼痛有明顯的鎮痛作用，效果比氫巴馬汀好。蛇床子素還可顯著改善小鼠記憶獲得，可能
    與影響腦內膽鹼酯酶活性及延緩細胞老化等因素有關。
    　　■對內分泌的作用
    　　性激素樣作用中醫認為蛇床子有溫腎壯陽功能，採用放射免疫測定法測定出蛇床子提取物中含有睪丸酮和雌二醇。國外已從蛇床子中分離得到具有強壯益精的活性成分��苯
    並呋喃類衍生物及單萜類衍生物。
    　　對下丘腦－垂體－靶腺影響蛇床子素和TCCM能顯著提高腎陽虛大鼠模型促甲狀腺激素（TSH）、T3、rT3和T4，表明可提高模型鼠的腺垂體－甲狀腺軸動能
    。
    　　拮抗激素引起的骨質疏鬆給大鼠長期口服TCCM，可有效防止潑尼鬆引起的骨質疏鬆，使骨小梁面積增加56％，各項骨計量學指標接近正常。TCCM和蛇床子素還
    能有效預防去卵巢大鼠由於雌激素不足而引起的骨吸收超過骨形成的高轉換型骨質疏鬆，作用強度不及尼爾雌醇，但副作用小。故蛇床子素有望成為防治絕經後婦女骨質疏鬆
    的藥物。
    　　■其他作用
    　　抗誘變與抗癌作用蛇床子素和歐芹屬素乙具有較強的抗誘變活性。一些香豆素類對癌細胞（Hela－S3）生長有抑制作用，其對癌細胞抑制強度為蛇床子素＞花椒毒
    酚＞異虎耳草素＞佛手柑內酯＞花椒毒素＞歐芹屬素乙。
    　　抗變態反應TCCM對組胺、乙酰膽鹼引起的整體豚鼠藥物性喘息具有明顯的保護作用，並能直接擴張豚鼠離體支氣管平滑肌，此作用可被β－受體阻斷劑(beta-adrenergic 
    blocker) 心得安 (Propranolol) 所阻斷。蛇床子素也能抑制小鼠被動皮膚過敏反應，對整體豚鼠組胺性喘息有
    保護作用。臨床上報道，用TCCM治療支氣管哮喘和喘息型支氣管炎發作期患者118例，效果顯著，總 有效率達87.3％。
    　　提高免疫功能採用醋酸氫化可的松 （Hydrocortisone acetate）造成腎
    陽虛小鼠模型，與正常對照組比較，腹腔巨噬細胞吞噬百分率和吞噬指數、血清溶血素50％溶血值、脾淋巴細胞3H－ TdR滲入數等指標明顯降低，用蛇床子
    素和TCCM（均為2.5％混懸液1.5毫升/天），連續灌胃20天，腎
    陽虛 
    組上述指標均有顯著提高，說明其可提高腎
    陽虛模型小鼠的免疫功能。
 
中國醫藥報

Chemical 
        ingredients:[1]
化學成份﹕[1]



鱗莖含粘液質（mucilage），粗脂肪（crude 
        fat），粗蛋白質（crude protein），粗纖維（crude fiber），無氮浸出物（Nfree exteact），戊聚糖（pentosan），多糖類（polysaccharides），其中粘液質主要成分是多糖，其次是纖維素（cellulose），半纖維素（hemicellulose），原果膠（protopectin）及水溶性果膠（pectin），還含糖（sugar），維生素（vitamin）C，胡蘿卜素（carotene），維生素（vitanin）B1、B2、A、PP，草酸（oxalic 
        acid），脂類（lipids），亞麻酸（linolenic acid），亞油酸（linoleic acid），棕櫚酸（palnitic acid），油酸（oleic 
        acid），花生酸（arachidic acid），泛醌-9及泛醌-10（ubiquinone-9 ,-10）。此外，鱗莖還含揮發油，油中主要成分為大蒜辣素（allicin），二烯丙基硫醚（allyl 
        sulfide）。
        根含鋁。
